column1: Letizia Ortiz Rocasolano  (Spanish pronunciation: [leˈtiθja oɾˈtiθ]; born 15 September 1972) is Queen of Spain via her marriage to King Felipe VI. She came from a middle-class family and worked as a journalist for ABC and EFE before becoming a news anchor at CNN+ and Televisión Española. In 2004
column3: then Prince of Asturias and heir apparent to the Spanish throne. Their daughters
column5: were born in 2005 and 2007 respectively. As Princess of Asturias
column8: in Spain and abroad. On her father-in-law's abdication in 2014
column9: Felipe and Letizia became king and queen.

column1: == Family ==
Letizia is the eldest daughter of Jesús José Ortiz Álvarez
column4: María de la Paloma Rocasolano Rodríguez
column5: a registered nurse and hospital union representative. She has two younger sisters
column7: whose death was widely reported by press as due to an intentional prescription drug overdose.She was baptised in the Catholic Church on 29 September 1972
column8: in Oviedo.Her parents divorced in 1999 and her father remarried  in Madrid on 18 March 2004 to fellow journalist Ana Togores.Letizia's paternal grandparents were José Luis Ortiz Velasco (ca. 1923–2005)
column9: a commercial employee at Olivetti; and María del Carmen "Menchu" Álvarez del Valle (born 1928)
column10: a radio broadcaster in Asturias for over 40 years. Her maternal grandfather was Francisco Julio Rocasolano Camacho (1918–2015)
column11: a mechanic and cab driver in Madrid for over 20 years who  was of French and Occitan origin.  Letizia's maternal grandmother
column12: Enriqueta Rodriguez Figueredo (1919–2008) was born in the Philippines to Spanish parents.British genealogists have provided evidence that through her mother's  Rocasolano lineage
column13: Letizia descends from Astorg Roquesoulane (died c.1564) and her coat-of-arms incorporates the arms of the Rocasolano family. Reports have suggested – and remain unproven – that on her paternal grandfather's side
column14: Letizia is a descendant of an untitled family descended from medieval nobility who served  as constables of Castile.

column1: == Education and career ==
Letizia attended La Gesta School in Oviedo
column2: before her family moved to Rivas-Vaciamadrid near Madrid
column3: where she attended the Ramiro de Maeztu High School. She completed a bachelor's degree in journalism
column4: at the Complutense University of Madrid
column5: as well as a master's degree in audiovisual journalism at the Institute for Studies in Audiovisual Journalism.During her studies
column6: Letizia worked for the Asturian daily newspaper La Nueva España and later for the newspaper ABC and the news agency EFE. After completing her master's degree
column9: working at the newspaper Siglo 21 and was working on her PhD; however
column10: she did not complete her doctoral thesis because she returned to Spain. After returning to Spain
column11: she worked for the Spanish version of the economic channel Bloomberg before moving to the news network CNN+.In 2000
column13: where she started working for the news channel 24 Horas. In 2002
column14: she anchored the weekly news report programme Informe Semanal and later the daily morning news programme Telediario Matinal on TVE 1. In August 2003
column15: a few months before her engagement to Felipe
column16: Letizia was promoted to anchor of the TVE daily evening news programme Telediario 2
column17: the most viewed newscast in Spain.

column5: she broadcast live from Ground Zero following the 9/11 attacks in New York and in 2003

column1: == First marriage ==
Letizia married Alonso Guerrero Pérez (born in 1962)
column2: a writer and a high-school literature teacher
column4: in a simple civil ceremony at Almendralejo
column6: after a 10-year courtship. The marriage was dissolved by divorce in 1999.

column1: == Second marriage and children ==
On 1 November 2003
column3: the Royal Household announced Letizia's engagement to Felipe
column5: she moved to live in a wing of the Zarzuela Palace until the day of her wedding. The Prince of Asturias had proposed to her with a 16-baguette diamond engagement ring with a white gold trim. She marked the occasion by giving him white gold and sapphire

column1: cufflinks and a classic book.The wedding took place on 22 May 2004 in the Cathedral Santa María la Real de la Almudena in Madrid. It was the first royal wedding in this cathedral. It had been nearly a century since the capital celebrated a royal wedding
column2: as the prince's parents married in Athens
column5: married in Seville and Barcelona respectively.

column1: Letizia's bridal gown was designed by Spanish fashion designer Manuel Pertegaz
column2: her bridal shoes by Pura López; and the veil
column3: a gift from Felipe to his bride
column4: was made of off-white silk tulle and hand-embroidered with detailing.

column1: As Letizia's previous marriage involved only a civil ceremony
column2: the Catholic Church does not consider it canonically valid and therefore did not require an annulment to proceed with a Catholic marriage to the Prince of Asturias.Letizia and Felipe have two daughters: Leonor
column4: born on 31 October 2005; and Infanta Sofía
column5: born on 29 April 2007. They were born at Ruber International Hospital in Madrid.

column1: == Princess of Asturias ==

Princess Letizia immediately joined in the duties of her husband and traveled extensively through Spain representing her father-in-law. They also represented Spain in other countries: she has traveled along with her husband to Jordan
column15: and Portugal. She also greeted international dignitaries
column16: along with other members of the royal family
column17: and attended gatherings of foreign royalty in Luxembourg
column18: for the silver wedding anniversary of the Grand Duke and Grand Duchess of Luxembourg
column19: and in the Netherlands for the 40th birthday of the Prince of Orange.Her solo agenda was announced in 2006
column20: shortly after the announcement of her second pregnancy. Letizia has performed a couple of audiences and her work focuses on social issues such as children rights
column23: her solo agenda started to grow in the quantity of events she performed by herself and Felipe's and Letizia's agendas became more distinct and separate. Letizia supported Spanish designers
column24: from couturiers such as Felipe Varela and Lorenzo Caprile to Zara and Mango
column25: and continues to as queen consort.

column1: == Queen of Spain ==
On 19 June 2014
column2: Letizia became Queen of Spain; as such
column3: she holds the style of Majesty.  She is the first Spanish-born queen consort since Mercedes of Orléans
column4: the first wife of Alfonso XII
column5: in 1878.  She is also the first Spanish queen to have been born as a commoner.

column1: Queen Letizia undertook her first solo engagement as queen on 23 June 2014 at the inauguration of the El Greco and modern painting exhibition at the National Prado museum in Madrid.In their first overseas trip as king and queen
column2: Felipe VI and Letizia met Pope Francis on 30 June 2014
column3: in the Apostolic Palace.  They later met with Cardinal Secretary of State Pietro Parolin
column5: under-secretary for Relations with States.  The visit followed one by King Juan Carlos I and Queen Sofia on 28 April.  In 2015
column6: Letizia was named Special Ambassador for Nutrition for the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization.Letizia and Felipe and the princesses still reside at the same residence where they have lived since 2004.  It is stated that the Palace of Zarzuela is a working place only for Felipe.In March 2016
column7: leaked text messages between Letizia and businessman Javier Lopez Madrid created a controversy.  Together with other executives and board members of the Caja Madrid and Bankia financial group
column8: Madrid had been accused of corruption.  In October 2014 Letizia pledged her support for him
column9: texting "We know who you are and you know who we are.  We know each other
column11: respect each other.  To hell with the rest.  Kisses yoga mate (miss you!!!)".  Felipe also joined in
column12: texting "We do indeed!"  Publication of the texts by the newspaper El Diario threatened to undo the line Felipe had drawn between himself and the scandal of Infanta Cristina and her husband
column13: as well as questions over the origins of ex-King Juan Carlos's private fortune.  A palace official subsequently stated that the King and Queen were no longer friends with Madrid due to his legal issues.

column1: == Titles and honours ==
At the time of her marriage to Prince Felipe
column2: Letizia was appointed to the Grand Cross of the Royal and Distinguished Order of Charles III as dame on  21 May 2004. Since then
column3: Letizia has received different appointments and decorations by foreign states and other Spanish honours.
